item.title: Every time you click this link, it will send you to a random Web 1.0 website
item.description: - The Ban Bread Now Foundation's website promotes a campaign against bread consumption, claiming it has negative health and societal effects.

item.title: Signal president says company will not comply with U.K. 'mass surveillance' law
item.description: - Signal president Meredith Whittaker opposes the proposed U.K.

item.title: A third of North America's birds have vanished
item.description: - Raw data analysis reveals that a third of North America's birds have disappeared over the past 50 years.

item.title: PostgreSQL: No More Vacuum, No More Bloat
item.description: - PostgreSQL is a popular database system known for its robustness and flexibility, but it has a challenge with the resource-consuming VACUUM process.

item.title: Wireshark Is 25: The email that started it all & lessons learned along the way
item.description: - 25 years ago, Wireshark, a network analyzer, was created and released as open source, changing the course of the developer's life.

item.title: Our paying customers need X, when will you fix it?
item.description: - Twitter has implemented a new pricing structure that restricts the option of unrolling tweets on the web to Premium members only.

item.title: Another World ported to FPGA
item.description: - The author has successfully remade the game "Another World" in hardware using an FPGA (Field Programmable Gate Array).

item.title: The theory versus the practice of "static websites"
item.description: - The article discusses the difference between static and dynamic websites, arguing that static websites are more dynamic and complicated than they appear, while also being easier to build and operate.

item.title: The Uxn Ecosystem
item.description: - The Uxn ecosystem is a personal computing stack that allows users to create and run their own tools and games.

item.title: The shady world of Brave selling copyrighted data for AI training
item.description: - Brave, a search engine, offers an API called Data for AI that allows users to use copyrighted material for AI training and inference.
